Reviews.Title: “GIVE ME BACK MY $100 BUCKS PICHIS!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Ayeiza P
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and i checked in on 0ct 11, 2011 for just one night. The girl at the front desk told me i had to pay a 100 deposit (which would be refunded) plus the cost of my room, which was cool. I just swiped my card and we went up to our room. Our room was very nice but, when we took our shower the water would barely come out of the shower head. We didn't check out the casino and restaurant because we had been out all day in Ponce. The real reason i rated this hotel poor is because i have yet to receive my deposit money back. GIVE ME BACK MY $100 BUCKS PICHIS!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “It was a very good weekend!!”
Reviews.Author: Blackiepr
Reviews.Content: We never expected that we will had a super experience visiting your facilities. We had fun, get some rest... in overol we had a great time. It was very comftable, the Hotel is gorgeous with awesome layouts. We feel like home. The only thing that we dind't like the most was Amapolas Rest. But for sure w'll recomend it and come back soon. Thanks a lot and keep it up the great job.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay just out in the country”
Reviews.Author: dmojames
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights last week. We were in PR for a wedding in the area and decided after much thought to stay here. The room was very clean and spacious. The bed was solo comfortable. I will say the water was very very hard but that wasn't too surprising. There was a complimentary breakfast everyday and the food was decent. I would highly recommend having a rental car given you are so far out in the country. All in all a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “This place is a hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: Maizy72
Reviews.Content: Excellent place to stay in the south area of PR. Modern suites, food was incredible and the staff very willing to help.

Reviews.Title: “I want to love this place...BUT”
Reviews.Author: zaezae
Reviews.Content: There are some BIG "BUT's".... I have given this place 2 chances and I still have some serious issues. I thought I was being an ovelry picky typical 'American', but my sweet Puerto Rican hosts assured me that my needs were not being met and I should NOT stay there again!! First stay: I found a pair of dirty men's boxer shorts (bright blue) on the white tiled floor in the bathroom, there was only 1 hanger in the closet, there was no luggage stand provided, neither of the 2 phones had a dial tone and when I asked about this I was told I needed to give them a credit card to make a call (obviously there was a translation issue). The drawers are so odd to open, they should have a sign explaining it. The worst for me was I complained about these issues several times to the front desk staff and either they didn't understand my english or they just wanted to ignore me, nothing happened until I sent an email to corporate that was routed to the front desk manager. Stay two: Maybe I'm just silly but I really wanted to give them a 2nd chance. There's no question that the location is ideal for the manufacturing facility I visit in Sabana Grande and this newly built hotel is much closer to a business hotel you would find in the states than some of the older properties (ex. Ponce Hilton). BUT, I just can't love it!! This time, things were up to snuff in terms of the room being set up well, but there was NO HOT WATER. The first morning I complained, I called down asking what to do. They said, first of all "some of our rooms have the hot/cold installed backwards". They also suggested that I "open the water and let it run for like 20 minutes". I tried both of those things and although after about 30 minutes it wasn't as cold, it certainly wouldn't be considered hot. Also, the water pressure is very poor. Again, I asked the front desk to address this and they said I could change rooms. When I returned home from work I asked if my hot water had been checked and I was met with a confused stair and the Erika checked through her book many times. She made a phone call and after the call she suggested that I change rooms. I said that I would try my hot water in my existing room and report back. It seemed almost hot so I went with it. The 2nd morning, I got out of bed, turned on the hot water, and went back to bed for a few minutes. Again, the shower was cold and got less cold by about 30 minutes of running. When I got home the 2nd day, the front desk manager was working and she urged me to change rooms again. I went to the 'new room' which I was told was prepped for me. I let the water run for 15 minutes in the 'new room' it was freezing. So in the end, I simply stuck out the cold water. Knowing that I was very very dissapointed. Also, my 2nd wake up call happened 30 minutes late. Good thing I knew better than to rely on them, I would've been later for work! In general, this place looks great on paper. The property is new and modern. Everything else is thumbs down! Also, Kareoke on Thursday night is way too loud!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: rain8949
Reviews.Content: I recommend. Good place to relax. Make sure you know the Spanish language though.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, but disappointed”
Reviews.Author: DandDTravelers
Reviews.Content: During the five of the six days my adult daughter and I traveled in Puerto Rico, we used points to stay free at Choice hotels. We were traveling in Western PR, which doesn't have a Choice hotel, so I researched for a nice place - since I was going to pay cash. The Best Western seemed like the place (and it is nice), but there were a few glitches, which caused me to be disappointed. The first room we were given had a huge area of the carpet wet from the AC. I was immediately given another room, which also had wet carpet by the AC unit at the window, but not as bad as the first. I called the front desk again and got the feeling this was probably in many (if not all) of the rooms - so I should just be happy this wet area was smaller than the first. A staff member brought me extra towels so I could soak up the water. By morning the dry towels I had put down (after soaking up the water that was there when we arrived) were soaked! The building seems new, so I don't know why there have not been able to properly address this problem. Another disappointment was the lack of salsa lessons promoted on the hotel's website for Thursday nights. My daughter was looking forward to these - and I had even called ahead before leaving on the trip to check on this - since it was an added value for the room rate I was paying; granted, there was a bit of a language barrier between me who speaks English and the front desk clerk who spoke Spanish; so I put my daughter (who speaks Spanish) on the phone, and she got a reply that the salsa lessons were offered on Thursday. Needless to say, when we arrived at the hotel, we were told the lesson were seasonal (despite the promo still on the Internet); but there was live music there that evening instead. The service at check-in went well - and the front desk staff truly seemed interested in helping me address the wet floor; but checkout was slow, with a line growing - yet no other staff came forward or were called to assist. The pool looked very good (though we did not use it) and the free breakfast was filling. For the money, I was disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for overnight stay”
Reviews.Author: dante007
Reviews.Content: Location - to be honest it was unplanned stay in this hotel. We just arrived from Mayaguez on searched for place to stay and just saw big hotel beside the road. Price was quite high but hotel seemed ok too. If You ask what there is to do I don't know. For me it was "oh, such a big hotel middle of nowhere and it's almost full..." Rooms - as I understand it was just renovated and looking for these old pictures I wondered if this is the same hotel where I stayed? Cause what I saw was new, clean hotel. Nothing bad to say. Amenities - I did a quick visit to casino but didn't played. The penny room was very attractive :) Room price included breakfast what was normal. Not like in Europe but I had it enough. Hotel also had a pool but I even didn't try to go there after I saw hordes of kids heading there. I know that there is no place for relaxing, just children screams. Overall - for me it's hotel for overnight stay. Actually it seemed more like business hotel and I didn't find any character there. Suggestion - ask receptionist for local restaurants. We were directed to local area where were 3-4 seafood restaurants and food was really good. It was appr 5km driving to Ponce direction.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in the SW of Puerto Rico...”
Reviews.Author: LeonViajante
Reviews.Content: The best hotel in the SW of Puerto Rico. I had stayed in the old facilities and the renovations are a complete new hotel. (In fact, it is- the old hotel is between the new one and the meeting areas). The only complain: to go to the meeting areas you have to walk outdoors. This is bad if you are attending a formal ball and is raining outside heavily. The staff is very courteous, friendly. The Amapola's Restaurant is excellent!! Nice pool, casino. Room is large with good closet, plenty of drawers, refrigerator and free Internet. Breakfast buffet style included. Excellent beds with plenty pillows. The place to stay if visiting the SW of PR.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Miss the Boat on this one...”
Reviews.Author: ElDuque006
Reviews.Content: Anyone that is travelling on the South coast of Puerto Rico needs to check this place out... The entire Hotel is brand new - (Grand Opening was evidently the first week of December 2009) and absolutely the best kept secret on the island that I've ever found (ahd have been coming to Puerto Rico for 10+ years to visit family and friends. Brand New Guestrooms - Bright and Airy Casino - Live Music in the lobby at night - Fantastic Pool Area - Friendly Staff, and food that is absolutely off the charts (breakfast is included by the way - and my family and I also had lunch and several dinners. It's some of if not the best food we've had since being on the island... Incidently - the Hotel is under the Best Western Brand for those looking for either "points" or peace of mind when booking in an unknown area. You'll love the place!

Reviews.Title: “Loved It !!!”
Reviews.Author: Tamichula
Reviews.Content: Although the rooms available were small and yes there was construction going on very close, the entire family enjoyed our stay there. There was no noise during evening or night hours.The restaurant food was great, the pool was clean, the rooms were very clean, the housekeeping staff was wonderful and very helpful. One specific office manager seemed to lack customer service skills, but the other office staff was amazing. They had many activities for the children and all activities were very well planned and scheduled. The atmosphere was very friendly and every tourist there felt like we were all a big family. The town and surrounding towns have many things to offer, such as great restaurants, sight seeing, cultural places to visit. The location is very close to the beautiful beaches, the fluorescent bay, night life, the dry forest, historical sites, and if you wonder a little farther you can enjoy all the wonderful things Puerto Rico has to offer, like Museums, shopping, casinos, etc.

Reviews.Title: “loving it”
Reviews.Author: tinkerbell051
Reviews.Content: i love it everytime ive been there three times. and each time is great from the friendly staff to the privacy of the rooms it's wonderful. I guess with the new facilities it will only get better. just hope that the offers of all included are still available. the food is wonderful.will be there next year

Reviews.Title: “Valiant Attempt At Mediocrity”
Reviews.Author: SN1752
Reviews.Content: To begin with, Guayanilla is in the middle of nowhere & is not a tourist destination; I used it as a stopover during an 8-day circumnavigation of the island. The pool was not in working order & there was massive construction going on right outside the property (they are adding a casino). The one bright spot was the restaurant which is a "Meson Gastronomico" & has certainly earned that certification. The property might fare better scrapping the hotel & just running the restaurant & bar. However, if it's good enough for Miss Puerto Rico to stay there (as she was during my trip)... I guess her standards are lower than mine.

Reviews.Title: “Not ready for prime time”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I planned to stay here two nights in April, but left after the first night.Nothing went right for us here, starting when we were searching to find the place. I don't remember the details, but the address is listed as being on a numbered route. Five miles north of town we eventually admitted that we'd missed it. We came back and searched... and searched... and eventually had to call for directions. (Thank you Sprint for 'home area' coverage in PR !)The room was tiny and cramped. A huge entertainment center only took up needless space and mocked the small TV inside. There was only space for a nightstand on one side of the bed.Part of our bad experience was due to timing. The road out in front was under construction, and it felt like it would rip out the suspension of our car every time we came and went. The pool was closed for major repairs. All in all I felt like I was trapped in a tiny cell with no place to go and nothing to do but stare at the walls.On the plus side, the staff was as friendly as they could be.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: First review, and it's very good! This very clean and well-maintained parador provides great value for the money. Location was especially appreciated: it's outside the traffic congestion of Ponce, but close enough (15 minutes to parking in historic Ponce) to enjoy sightseeing, dining, etc. It's also on the west side of Ponce, providing a convenient getaway to La Parguera's luminescent lagoon and the whole southwest and west of Puerto Rico. I arrived late at night, called via cell phone for directions from Ponce, and was dreading the usual sleepy, semi-incoherent mumbles from a night clerk. However, I was quite welcomed, and obtained clear, simple directions. It turns out I didn't even need them, as this parador is very clearly signed from Hwy 2. I *highly* recommend this place! They are expanding, and deservedly so.

HotelInfo.Name: BEST WESTERN Pichi's Hotel Conv. Ctr & Casino
HotelInfo.Address: Exit 205 road 127 km 8.6 | Guayanilla, 00656, Puerto Rico
